headline: Homemade Black Bean Veggie Burgers
description: This black bean burger recipe with veggies and spices is easy to make and so flavorful ‚Äî you'll never want to eat frozen veggie burgers again!

video.description: These 5-star veggie burgers have it all over frozen burgers.
video.name: Homemade Black Bean Veggie Burgers

name: Homemade Black Bean Veggie Burgers
recipeIngredient: 1 (16 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
0.5 green bell pepper, cut into 2 inch pieces
1 teaspoon Thai chili sauce or hot sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat. Lightly oil a sheet of aluminum foil with cooking spray.
Mash black beans in a medium bowl with a fork until thick and pasty.
Finely chop bell pepper, onion, and garlic in a food processor. Stir chopped vegetables into mashed beans.
Stir together egg, chili powder, cumin, and chili sauce in a small bowl. Add to the mashed beans and stir to combine. Mix in bread crumbs until the mixture is sticky and holds together.
Divide the mixture into four patties and place on the prepared foil.
Grill on the preheated grill for about 8 minutes on each side.

review.reviewBody: By gum I tell ya! These are the best veggie burgers I've ever made! I made mine l a bit bigger, brushed with a small amount of olive oil and extended the cooking time til they had a nice brown color on the outside.
Easy to make, economical, HEALTHY & DELICIOUS. It was my first time to make a Veggie Burger & I‚Äôm so happy with the result. This is now my favourite üçî

These are fantastic. Me and my hubby "the meat eater", loved them. I've made this several times now. Due to personal preference I swapped out the chili powder and cumin with a little McCormick's GrillMates Hamburger seasoning. It really gave it more of a real hamburger taste. I cook them on the grill on some oiled foil but I'm sure they would be fine baked too.
The best! I rinsed and drained the beans and used a bit of cheese cloth to get all the liquid out of the onion/pepper mixture. These held together great and were super-satisfying!

We love them. I started eating vegetarian, plant based dishes about 1¬Ω years ago. It helped me lose 30 lbs. I make enough for 20 (3 x recipe). Then freeze what I don't need. Then they are available for a quick dinner. NOTE: Get an electric pressure cooker. It makes the job so easy

The flavor is amazing! I prefer to cook stovetop in my cast iron skillet so I should have adjusted cook time for that. I only cooked one patty out of my mix so next time I‚Äôll put it in the air fryer on bake. Insides were a little mushy but tasty while the outside was perfect!
Very good flavor, it goes well with a cheese slice and pickles
Easy to make but overall kind of tasteless and mushy. I would not make them again.

I made it as close as possible to the original recipe. It was a little bland and it lacked texture. It was still a lot better than store-bought! 
I think next time I'll combine it with a quinoa burger recipe.

These are great black been burgers! I made a few alterations, however. I used 2tsp of chili powder and 2 tsp of cumin. I used 2 tsp of a standard chili sauce as that is what I had on hand and 2 eggs were needed. I followed the instructions to mix but once all ingredients together I once more put all in the food processor for a few seconds. As others did in the reviews I made my 4 patties on parchment paper and put in the freezer for 1/2 hour before grilling. They tasted great and presented well. Made twice and this last time had black beans in the refrigerator that I had cooked a previous day that I used. Using my cooked beans they were easier to patty but tasted the same as when I used the canned. Thanks for sharing this healthy burger recipe.

I made these for my lunch and wow! I am a meat eater but this had so much flavor. I substitute 3 tablespoons of coconut flour for the bread crumbs to cut down on carbs and calories. I added a dash of what that here sauce and a pinch of chipotle powder. Then onion and garlic powder too. I thought it was a great base recipe to add my own spin on. Thanks and will keep in rotation!

I used brown lentils, omitted the bell pepper and the hot sauce. I used a vegan egg replacer (Bob‚Äôs Red Mill Egg Replacer) instead and I added about 3 tbsp of chopped scallions. I also added an extra 1/4 cup of breadcrumbs and because they were kinda crumbly I put them in the freezer for 10 mins to firm up. I baked them and then fried them in olive oil to get a nice crust on it. It is very delicious and customizable. 10/10
This recipe is great and so easy! I use flax seed to substitute the egg. I don't buy frozen anymore.
I love this recipe. I caramelize the onions with butter and parsley and mix in at the end. I also just cut up the green peppers real fine. It‚Äôs delicious
Held together very nicely, which is always my issue with bbb.but not a whole lot of flavor.

This is delicious... a little spicy for hubby. 
We'll definitely be making them again as a family favourite!
These were better than I expected, but I think I would add more hot sauce next time. Was easy to make and tasted good.

Finally made this recipe, delicious and simple. Be sure to drain the beans well. First batch was loose, broke easily(my fault). Made a second batch to freeze, seperated with wax paper for easy lunches. Will be making this again and again! TY
Fantastic!

I have served these a lot and they go over well. 
We made a couple of little changes. We saute the onions, peppers, and garlic before adding it. We also added 1/8 cup of corn, but is totally optional.

This recipe was amazing. I didn‚Äôt have an issue with it falling apart. I used a food processor to chop up everything and I dried everything first as some people recommended. I didn‚Äôt measure seasons lol and I was able to use only one egg and I used bread crumbs, I also didn‚Äôt have to freeze them prior to cooking it. I will be making this again

This burger was amazing. We only eat meatless once a week so we try things that we think will be satisfying and delicious. Well, this recipe is a winner! The only thing we changed was that we used a teaspoon of cumin and chili seasoning instead of a Tbsp. It didn‚Äôt affect the taste or texture one bit and pleased my non spice loving daughter. Loved the thick and meaty consistency. Thanks for the recipe!

I made this according to the recipe because I was in a hurry and didn‚Äôt read the reviews. So according to the original recipe the flavor is good but it makes more than four servings. It makes maybe 6 or 7 servings. The flavor is nice but the texture is similar to refried beans. It definitely needs less food processor mixing and more bread crumbs or oatmeal or something to make it thicker.
Turned out great. Baked in oven and added chopped fresh cilantro. Only used 1/4 cup of bread crumbs. They would have been too dry with 1/2 cup.

I followed some other comments and dried out my rinsed can of beans. I sauteed the finely diced onion, red bell pepper and a couple of mushrooms with a bit of olive oil, garlic powder and kosher salt, until the moisture cooked out and it reduced. Instead of breadcrumbs, I blended a cup of oats ....When the veggies cooled, I mixed them with the beans in a food processor. Then, with my clean hands, I mixed it all together with the oats, beaten egg, a bit of flax seed, a couple dashes of worcestershire sauce and a couple tablespoons of picante sauce.... a bit more kosher salt and pepper....covered and put in the fridge to fry later......it seems to stick together just fine and can't wait to try it ! Yum

Had this on a brioche bun with mustard, ketchup, pickles and lettuce and it was great. Going to try this as meatball substitute for a bulgogi dish.

Thanks!

My husband and I are looking to incorporate more vegetarian meals into our dinners. This was the first meal we tried and we both really liked it! I put in less cumin and added more garlic, but other than that I followed the recipe exactly. Served on a burger bun with burger toppings and cheese.

I tried to follow the direction exactly but it lacked flavor so I had to punch it up a bit with a little salt (unused low sodium black beans) a few pinches of sugar to cut the bitterness of the garlic. I was hesitant to add to much bread crumbs so I wouldn‚Äôt make it so dry. It looked and tasted great but the texture threw us all off completely. I should have listened to the one review when they said let the beans dry and drain (strain) the wet ?ingredients. Not doing that added to much moisture. We will try it again but following these extra tips then I‚Äôll see if my family will not disown me.
No changes made and the entire family loved it!
this dish was easy to make and was very tasty.

I love this recipe. Here's what I found that worked best for me:
Parchment paper works the best. No oil is needed.
Drain the processed/blended veggies-it makes the burgers less soggy.
I used 3/4 cup of bread crumbs. 
I put cheese on them in the last 2 minutes or so of baking. 
They are yummo!
I wouldn't call it a burger, maybe a patty just ok. I refrigerated for a few hours before I baked it. had to triple the bread crumbs for it to hold together.
Enjoyed it. Although I added jalape√±os. Better than store bought.
Finally nailed the black bean burger. I used onion powder instead to cut back on time and wetness.
Kids loved it- couldn't tell the difference from a beef hamburger

Very disappointed. I froze patties after making and ate on a different day with cooking via skillet. Flavor okay but texture too soft and mushy. Eating this instead of burger with my family and was not appealing. Maybe ground oats or brown rice instead of bread crumbs would be better.

Based on other reviews, I made sure to pat dry the black beans and drain the onion/green pepper/garlic mixture. Instead of 1/2 cup breadcrumbs, I used 3/4 cup whole wheat Ritz crackers. Froze patties before cooking with olive oil in a skillet. Yum!

Awful. Too much cumin. I looked at other recipes for black bean burgers and D those with cumin only added one teaspoon not one tablespoon. My burgers tasted like dirt as the cumin was so powerful . The seasonings in this recipe were way over portioned and overpowered the burger to make it inedible.

I doubled the recipe so I could have leftover patties for lunch. I have to admit that I eyeballed the spices and added some additional garlic and onion powders to the mix. Didn't squeeze out a ton of moisture from the pepper/onion mix and it still worked well. Added a couple shakes of Worcestershire sauce when I whisked the eggs. Eyeballed a combo of panko, bread crumbs and French fried onions until the whole mix became the texture I wanted. Divided the mixture in half added a handful of parmesan and made 4 patties and baked. Made the other 4 patties and pan fried with a little canola oil. Both versions turned out wonderfully! Made my burger with fresh spinach, tomato, raw onion, guacamole and chipotle mayo. Served with baked sweet potato rounds. Yum!

Great recipe. I added a few items the 2nd time I made recipe. 1/2 cup cranrasins, 1/2 cup oatmeal, 1 tsp paprika, 3 carrots shredded (squeezed dry) and full onion and pepper and 1 more garlic clove, with extras, made 5 patties.
Drained the onion mixture after processing. Had no problem with mixture sticking together but froze the patties before cooking as recommended by others.

Was good according to the recipe. I can't see anyone being able to put these patties on a grill since the mixture is as moist as cookie dough. Better to bake them. I spiced this up by substituting half the bell pepper with jalape√±os and adding wheat germ to firm it up. Thanks for the recipe!

I really liked this recipe. I doubled it and was able to get 10 burgers out of it. I made sure my beans were dry and my garlic/onion/pepper mix was too. I didn't use as much chili powder as indicated, added some salt and also added an extra egg. I put them in the freezer and then grilled them on tin foil. I would make them again.

So good! I'm trying to switch to a little more plant based lifestyle and these really were so good! I did the onions first in the food processor then added everything else and mixed. I also used oatmeal and it worked great. Might add more next time. I didn't use that much cumin 1/2 tsp. I fried on a hot cast iron in avocado oil and they were perfect. Will make again!

Wonderful as is, but here are a few tips that worked for me (personal preferences): 1. Don't mash the beans. 2. Finely mince the vegetables, adding one medium carrot. 3. Saute the veggies and spices in 1 TB oil (this allows the spices to 'bloom' for a more intense flavor). 4. Use 2 eggs. 5. Use panko bread crumbs. 6. Freeze burgers between pieces of waxed paper. 7. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes per side. 8. Serve with plain or spicy mayonnaise. Nutritious, economical, and appealing to vegetarians and meat-eaters alike. Thank you for a wonderful recipe!
I loved the flavour of these burgers, but next time I am going to follow Kelly's review because mine fell apart after I baked them in the oven. Definitely worth another shot.
I thought these were delicious! I followed the recipe, just made sure I squeezed the water out of the veggies after I processed them. They held together great and cooked up beautifully.
made as showed added a little moe bread crumbs so not wet. Really heavy need to cut down on the spice husband said too strong. Added cheese and other toppings but could not finish wierd taste.

Woah!!! This was the first time I‚Äôve ever made veggie burgers and it was so good. The trick was to chop up the veggies and then squeeze out all the excess water from the pepper and onion in a paper towel before putting it into the mixture. Instead of the smoky cumin and chili powder five, I used a little Italian vinaigrette with dried oregano, basil, and smoked paprika. It came out amazing, the entire family devoured it! I will definitely be remaking with canned kidney beans next week!
Delicious! Just need to be careful to not be too dry, otherwise, it is amazing!

These were very tasty. Not too spicy. Agree with other reviewers; they were very wet despite drying the beans and removing all the water from the onions and peppers. I used rolled oats rather than breadcrumbs to make them gluten free and baked them a few minutes longer than recommended per side to crisp up their outer surface before flipping them over. I may try more beans or oats to make them less wet. I will make these again.
A great recipe. I also made a version using black-eyed peas as well. Very tasty.

Turned out pretty good. I have made other bean burgers that didn't hold together as well as this I used much less chili powder than the recipe calls for, and it was still spicy. Next time I am going to add some liquid smoke. (I made mine in the oven not on the grill.)

Best burgers! I substitute an egg for flaxseed egg. Mixed in some mushrooms, orange bell pepper, and red onion. I put in Cayenne pepper seasoning because I used the rest of my cumin for another recipe. Slapped on some vegan cheese, lettuce, and tomatoes. I was singing till the very last bite. I have the rest in the freezer for later this week.

I've never had a veggie burger before, but I thought this was pretty good. I did go easy on the chili powder, but I always tend to. Next time, I think I'll go for the full amount to add more flavor. They were a bit hard to shape, but I see some solutions for that in other reviews.

This is an easy recipe and I‚Äôve made them three times. Started to get creative by trying different spices and added jalape√±o. I also increased amount of bread crumbs, when making patties you‚Äôll get a feel of how much is needed. I chill them before grilling.
My husband didn‚Äôt even know I made these from scratch they were so good

Amazing! So easy to make. I followed the recipe exactly and they are perfect. I mashed the beans with a pastry cutter and that made it very easy. I dont have a food processor so I just finely chopped the onion by hand. If you dont have a pepper you can substitute some corn instead! Pop those patties onto a baking sheet lined w. parchment paper and straight into the freezer. Cooked from frozen on the bbq and they're divine. Like, even if you're not vegetarian you'll love putting one of these on the bun WITH your burger. So flavourful.
Loved it! The only issue was that this created 10 burgers instead of four (an issue since there's only two of us eating haha) but next time, I'll just lessen the quantity. Super easy to make, also.
Delicious but fell apart in the pan while flipping despite the draining of all liquid beforehand.
I think I‚Äôll make these again! They‚Äôre pretty good, but they‚Äôre less like veggie burgers and more like bean patties.

Turned out OK with the help of the reviewer who suggested extra bread crumbs. Only wish the center was not mushy. Tried one on stove top and on in air fryer. Both mushy centers. Update: Made them flatter and cooked them about 15 minutes in the air fryer, Much better. Made a double batch today and froze them.
They were a bit too soft so I place under the broiler (with feta cheese on top) for a couple of minutes at the end . Delicious!

I've made these twice now and these are pretty good for a base. 
I think half an onion is WAY too much. The flavor gets way more intense when it's put into the food processor. Next time I'll use a quarter of an onion or less. 
I also only used about 1.5 tsp of chili powder and cumin each and added salt.
They also have ended up quite runny both times even with extra bread cumbs. I'd suggest making them in advance so that you have time to freeze them so that they keep their shape while grilling.
Add more egg. The recipe that is supplied here has a tendency to crumble.

I added 1/4 cup sweet relish, fresh saut√©d chopped mushrooms, and 3/4 cup of chopped walnuts. You need to add an extra 1/4 cup of bread crumbs due to the moisture from the relish. I used Italian bread crumbs.
 Toast the bun and add Swiss cheese to the black bean burger.
Absolutely Awesome.

Simple and yummy. 
Great tips from other reviews:
1. Use oatmeal rather than bread crumbs.
2. Rinse and drain beans

We really liked these burgers, kids and all. If I could give it a 4.5 ?? I would. We added corn (a little too much though - next time we will use less) and didn‚Äôt measure the bread crumbs. Just added a bit at a time until the consistency felt right. We also used not as much cumin and chili powder. Maybe a little more than 1/2 tbsp. The full amount just seemed too much. It was just right for us. But I think I will play around with the flavorings. Maybe do bbq sauce instead of sweet chili and play with the spices to see what creations we can make. Thanks for sharing. This was yummy!!!
They were a little wet but still worked really well. Use ranch as a condiment

I made these black bean burgers and they came out perfect! I doubled the recipe (since I have a large family) and added an extra 1/2 of bread crumbs and they stayed together! I also made sure I drained everything very well even the garlic and added corn!! I have small children and they even liked these black bean burgers!!!
This recipe is so good and hella cheap when you have 7 people to feed I added a little more breadcrumbs but that‚Äôs it
I‚Äôve never had veggie burgers before and gave this one a go for my fianc√©‚Äôs lunches. The only change I made was red pepper instead of green. He said they were absolutely amazing and spicy.
I made a couple of substitutons: no bell peppers and salsa instead of chili or hot sauce. Delicious burgers!!!

I really liked the taste of this. I only used 1/4 of the onion though. 1/2 seemed like way too much for my taste. 

Will definitely be making this again.
Outstanding great flavor! Next time I make them I will make a double order to freeze them. They were very firm which is nice.
Girl it was so good shoooooot

This dish was very taste. The only problem was it didn't stay together. Wish I would have read the reviews before I cooked it. If it would have been more of a burger it would have 5 stars. I will try this recipe again with some of the suggestions below. First time making a dish from all recipes.
I followed this recipe and it was delish,I double the recipe and froze half of it, and it was just as delicious, I will be making this again! ??
Would make again. Very tasty. Didn't have any Thai chili but basted with sweet chili heat bbq sauce. Whole family enjoyed!
Love it very simple and delicious

It's easy to chop the green pepper, onion in a food processor; add about 2/3's can of drained/rinsed black beans and pulse just a couple of times but don't make them super smooth; add the other 1/3 can and pulse just once.

Awesome burger! To keep it plant based I used a flax egg. I also added caramelized onion, red pepper, chipotle chili flakes and some corn salsa. Definitely comes out better after resting in the fridge.

These worked out great for me! Husband says they are the best black bean burger he‚Äôs ever had! I did not use the onion and pepper but used a tablespoon of minced garlic with the beans and seasoned with cumin, onion powder, salt and Worcestershire sauce. They came out great!
made this recipe with extra breadcrumbs as some suggested and it was a huge hit with the whole family. The flavor was great, not too spicy. Will become a staple in our house

I have to agree with some others regarding this recipe. The burgers do not get stiff enough to form or keep from sticking. The other problem I experienced was that the outside cooked great, but the inside of the burger was still soft. I think the temperature should be dropped and they should cook a little longer. 
I modified this recipe. The original was not right for me. I doubled the bread crumbs and I also added some Oats to the mix. This allowed me to be able to stiffen them up to form them. I placed the on a lightly oiled pan, but the still stuck to the pan when turning over. 
Overall they were not bad. Another learning experience was that next time I will not go light on seasoning. I added extra spices than given because of my taste, and it was not enough. They were good, but needed more flavor. 
Next time I will also add a little cheese to the mix. This will help with binding the burgers and will add additional flavor.

I guess I don't like cumin, and probably will make these again using white beans instead of black. Same feelings about falafel. They're ok, but I would prefer a different blend of spices, like Greek or Italian, but I'm not a cook, so no idea where to start. I doubled the egg, and I used 2 slices of whole grain rye bread instead of bread crumbs. They held together perfectly. I baked them.
I've made these a few times now and they are very tasty! I skip the hot sauce- it's just not my thing. However, last time I made them I tried "spicy" black beans and they were delicious.

Great recipe. I used a red bell pepper instead of green, and also added half a grated zucchini and a grated carrot. I then used a hand blender to mush everything together, as I don't have a food processor. No problems with consistency. I also used 1 teaspoon of Tobasco Sauce. They're definitely the best veggie burgers I've ever tasted.

I've made 3 this 4 different nights this week in 3 different versions. With and w/o onions and w n w/o Chile powder and cumin. All were good and great meatless options with sauteed veggies and/ or veggie chips. Thanks for sharing.

So easy and fast! You're right - I won't be buying frozen veggie burgers again. These were easy and fast to prepare. Nice knowing exactly what is in my burger! I didn't change anything on the recipe. It was awesome just as written. Thanks.
Great flavor, but they didn't stick together too well.
Wasn‚Äôt a huge fan of the flavor I‚Äôm a meat eater so I know the difference and I‚Äôd way rather have some meat in my stomach. Was kinda bland for me but it‚Äôs healthy so I ate it
doubled the recipe without doubling the spices. Used a potato masher instead of a fork for quick and easy mashing. Stayed together and was delicious! Will make again!

This is a fantastic base recipe, but you need to add to it. I added shiitake mushrooms, cilantro, 1/2 jalape√±o and carrots. The most important thing I did was saut√© on medium the veggies (mushrooms, onions, garlic bell pepper and the jalape√±o) in olive oil and some black pepper for about 5 minutes. (Add the garlic last so it doesn‚Äôt burn.) Just a slight saut√© brings out a crazy depth of flavor and is worth the extra few minutes. I did not add the carrot or cilantro or the saute, but I suppose you can.

I prepped the patty mixture ahead of time. Formed 4 meatballs shapes and put them in the refrigerator until I was ready to cook. Once on the pan I smashed into a Patty. I feel refrigerating helped it stick together better. I was able to make on a grill pan. Approx 8 min on high each side. I added this to a salad - Boston Bibb lettuce, red pepper, carrots , red cabbage, scallions. I also made a dressing with fresh juiced ginger (you can mince instead), soy sauce, Rice vinegar, olive oil, garlic.
I have tried to make bb burgers before, with no success. Tonight I had success! These were delicious and super easy to make.

These are perfect as I‚Äôm living over seas in a nation that doesn‚Äôt have much meat. When I‚Äôm craving a burger this is my go to. I tend to make the green pepper mix a full liquid and then add some smaller pieces if want a different texture.

Great tasting burger! I followed the recipe with the exception of using a yellow bell pepper instead of green because I happened to already have one in my fridge. I also added 1/4 cup of corn and just a tad extra bread crumbs as suggested from other reviewers.

I baked them in the oven which is my only regret because the patties came out much softer then we preferred. Next time I will fry them up in a skillet so they get a nice crispy texture.
I've made it twice and the second time was definitely better! Next time, I will add just a little pink sea salt to the recipe. Less fat than pre-packaged patties and well worth the prep!
